00061 #ifdef HAVE_TCP_SENDPAGE_USE_SOCKET
00062 # define cfs_tcp_sendpage(sk, page, offset, size, flags) \
00063         tcp_sendpage((sk)->sk_socket, page, offset, size, flags)
00064 #else /* !HAVE_TCP_SENDPAGE_USE_SOCKET */
00065 # define cfs_tcp_sendpage(sk, page, offset, size, flags) \
00066         tcp_sendpage(sk, page, offset, size, flags)
00067 #endif /* HAVE_TCP_SENDPAGE_USE_SOCKET */

00069 /* assume one thread for each connection type */
00070 #define SOCKNAL_NSCHEDS         3
00071 #define SOCKNAL_NSCHEDS_HIGH    (SOCKNAL_NSCHEDS << 1)
00072 
00073 #define SOCKNAL_PEER_HASH_SIZE  101             /* # peer lists */
00074 #define SOCKNAL_RESCHED         100             /* # scheduler loops before reschedule */
00075 #define SOCKNAL_INSANITY_RECONN 5000            /* connd is trying on reconn infinitely */
00076 #define SOCKNAL_ENOMEM_RETRY    CFS_TICK        /* jiffies between retries */
00077 
00078 #define SOCKNAL_SINGLE_FRAG_TX      0           /* disable multi-fragment sends */
00079 #define SOCKNAL_SINGLE_FRAG_RX      0           /* disable multi-fragment receives */
00080 
00081 #define SOCKNAL_VERSION_DEBUG       0           /* enable protocol version debugging */
00082 
00083 /* risk kmap deadlock on multi-frag I/O (backs off to single-frag if disabled).
00084  * no risk if we're not running on a CONFIG_HIGHMEM platform. */
00085 #ifdef CONFIG_HIGHMEM
00086 # define SOCKNAL_RISK_KMAP_DEADLOCK  0
00087 #else
00088 # define SOCKNAL_RISK_KMAP_DEADLOCK  1
00089 #endif
00090 
00091 struct ksock_sched_info;
00092 
00093 typedef struct                                  /* per scheduler state */
00094 {
00095         spinlock_t              kss_lock;       /* serialise */
00096         struct list_head        kss_rx_conns;   /* conn waiting to be read */
00097         /* conn waiting to be written */
00098         struct list_head        kss_tx_conns;
00099         /* zombie noop tx list */
00100         struct list_head        kss_zombie_noop_txs;
00101         wait_queue_head_t       kss_waitq;      /* where scheduler sleeps */
00102         /* # connections assigned to this scheduler */
00103         int                     kss_nconns;
00104         struct ksock_sched_info *kss_info;      /* owner of it */
00105 #if !SOCKNAL_SINGLE_FRAG_RX
00106         struct page             *kss_rx_scratch_pgs[LNET_MAX_IOV];
00107 #endif
00108 #if !SOCKNAL_SINGLE_FRAG_TX || !SOCKNAL_SINGLE_FRAG_RX
00109         struct kvec             kss_scratch_iov[LNET_MAX_IOV];
00110 #endif
00111 } ksock_sched_t;
00112 
00113 struct ksock_sched_info {
00114         int                     ksi_nthreads_max; /* max allowed threads */
00115         int                     ksi_nthreads;   /* number of threads */
00116         int                     ksi_cpt;        /* CPT id */
00117         ksock_sched_t           *ksi_scheds;    /* array of schedulers */
00118 };
00119 
00120 #define KSOCK_CPT_SHIFT                 16
00121 #define KSOCK_THREAD_ID(cpt, sid)       (((cpt) << KSOCK_CPT_SHIFT) | (sid))
00122 #define KSOCK_THREAD_CPT(id)            ((id) >> KSOCK_CPT_SHIFT)
00123 #define KSOCK_THREAD_SID(id)            ((id) & ((1UL << KSOCK_CPT_SHIFT) - 1))
00124 
00125 typedef struct                                  /* in-use interface */
00126 {
00127         __u32           ksni_ipaddr;            /* interface's IP address */
00128         __u32           ksni_netmask;           /* interface's network mask */
00129         int             ksni_nroutes;           /* # routes using (active) */
00130         int             ksni_npeers;            /* # peers using (passive) */
00131         char            ksni_name[IFNAMSIZ];    /* interface name */
00132 } ksock_interface_t;
00133 
00134 typedef struct
00135 {
00136         /* "stuck" socket timeout (seconds) */
00137         int              *ksnd_timeout;
00138         /* # scheduler threads in each pool while starting */
00139         int              *ksnd_nscheds;
00140         int              *ksnd_nconnds;         /* # connection daemons */
00141         int              *ksnd_nconnds_max;     /* max # connection daemons */
00142         int              *ksnd_min_reconnectms; /* first connection retry after (ms)... */
00143         int              *ksnd_max_reconnectms; /* ...exponentially increasing to this */
00144         int              *ksnd_eager_ack;       /* make TCP ack eagerly? */
00145         int              *ksnd_typed_conns;     /* drive sockets by type? */
00146         int              *ksnd_min_bulk;        /* smallest "large" message */
00147         int              *ksnd_tx_buffer_size;  /* socket tx buffer size */
00148         int              *ksnd_rx_buffer_size;  /* socket rx buffer size */
00149         int              *ksnd_nagle;           /* enable NAGLE? */
00150         int              *ksnd_round_robin;     /* round robin for multiple interfaces */
00151         int              *ksnd_keepalive;       /* # secs for sending keepalive NOOP */
00152         int              *ksnd_keepalive_idle;  /* # idle secs before 1st probe */
00153         int              *ksnd_keepalive_count; /* # probes */
00154         int              *ksnd_keepalive_intvl; /* time between probes */
00155         int              *ksnd_credits;         /* # concurrent sends */
00156         int              *ksnd_peertxcredits;   /* # concurrent sends to 1 peer */
00157         int              *ksnd_peerrtrcredits;  /* # per-peer router buffer credits */
00158         int              *ksnd_peertimeout;     /* seconds to consider peer dead */
00159         int              *ksnd_enable_csum;     /* enable check sum */
00160         int              *ksnd_inject_csum_error; /* set non-zero to inject checksum error */
00161         int              *ksnd_nonblk_zcack;    /* always send zc-ack on non-blocking connection */
00162         unsigned int     *ksnd_zc_min_payload;  /* minimum zero copy payload size */
00163         int              *ksnd_zc_recv;         /* enable ZC receive (for Chelsio TOE) */
00164         int              *ksnd_zc_recv_min_nfrags; /* minimum # of fragments to enable ZC receive */
00165 #ifdef CPU_AFFINITY
00166         int              *ksnd_irq_affinity;    /* enable IRQ affinity? */
00167 #endif
00168 #ifdef SOCKNAL_BACKOFF
00169         int              *ksnd_backoff_init;    /* initial TCP backoff */
00170         int              *ksnd_backoff_max;     /* maximum TCP backoff */
00171 #endif
00172 #if SOCKNAL_VERSION_DEBUG
00173         int              *ksnd_protocol;        /* protocol version */
00174 #endif
00175 } ksock_tunables_t;
00176 
00177 typedef struct
00178 {
00179         __u64             ksnn_incarnation;     /* my epoch */
00180         spinlock_t        ksnn_lock;            /* serialise */
00181         struct list_head  ksnn_list;            /* chain on global list */
00182         int               ksnn_npeers;          /* # peers */
00183         int               ksnn_shutdown;        /* shutting down? */
00184         int               ksnn_ninterfaces;     /* IP interfaces */
00185         ksock_interface_t ksnn_interfaces[LNET_MAX_INTERFACES];
00186 } ksock_net_t;
00187 
00189 #define SOCKNAL_CONND_TIMEOUT  120
00190 
00191 #define SOCKNAL_CONND_RESV     1
00192 
00193 typedef struct
00194 {
00195         int                     ksnd_init;      /* initialisation state */
00196         int                     ksnd_nnets;     /* # networks set up */
00197         struct list_head        ksnd_nets;      /* list of nets */
00198         /* stabilize peer/conn ops */
00199         rwlock_t                ksnd_global_lock;
00200         /* hash table of all my known peers */
00201         struct list_head        *ksnd_peers;
00202         int                     ksnd_peer_hash_size; /* size of ksnd_peers */
00203 
00204         int                     ksnd_nthreads;  /* # live threads */
00205         int                     ksnd_shuttingdown; /* tell threads to exit */
00206         /* schedulers information */
00207         struct ksock_sched_info **ksnd_sched_info;
00208 
00209         atomic_t      ksnd_nactive_txs;    /* #active txs */
00210 
00211         /* conns to close: reaper_lock*/
00212         struct list_head        ksnd_deathrow_conns;
00213         /* conns to free: reaper_lock */
00214         struct list_head        ksnd_zombie_conns;
00215         /* conns to retry: reaper_lock*/
00216         struct list_head        ksnd_enomem_conns;
00217         /* reaper sleeps here */
00218         wait_queue_head_t       ksnd_reaper_waitq;
00219         /* when reaper will wake */
00220         cfs_time_t        ksnd_reaper_waketime;
00221         /* serialise */
00222         spinlock_t        ksnd_reaper_lock;
00223 
00224         int               ksnd_enomem_tx;      /* test ENOMEM sender */
00225         int               ksnd_stall_tx;       /* test sluggish sender */
00226         int               ksnd_stall_rx;       /* test sluggish receiver */
00227 
00228         /* incoming connection requests */
00229         struct list_head        ksnd_connd_connreqs;
00230         /* routes waiting to be connected */
00231         struct list_head        ksnd_connd_routes;
00232         /* connds sleep here */
00233         wait_queue_head_t       ksnd_connd_waitq;
00234         /* # connds connecting */
00235         int                     ksnd_connd_connecting;
00237         long                    ksnd_connd_failed_stamp;
00239         unsigned                ksnd_connd_starting;
00241         long                    ksnd_connd_starting_stamp;
00243         unsigned                ksnd_connd_running;
00244         /* serialise */
00245         spinlock_t              ksnd_connd_lock;
00246 
00247         /* list head for freed noop tx */
00248         struct list_head        ksnd_idle_noop_txs;
00249         /* serialise, g_lock unsafe */
00250         spinlock_t              ksnd_tx_lock;
00251 
00252 } ksock_nal_data_t;
00253 
00254 #define SOCKNAL_INIT_NOTHING    0
00255 #define SOCKNAL_INIT_DATA       1
00256 #define SOCKNAL_INIT_ALL        2
00257 
00258 /* A packet just assembled for transmission is represented by 1 or more
00259  * struct kvec fragments (the first frag contains the portals header),
00260  * followed by 0 or more lnet_kiov_t fragments.
00261  *
00262  * On the receive side, initially 1 struct kvec fragment is posted for
00263  * receive (the header).  Once the header has been received, the payload is
00264  * received into either struct kvec or lnet_kiov_t fragments, depending on
00265  * what the header matched or whether the message needs forwarding. */
00266 
00267 struct ksock_conn;                              /* forward ref */
00268 struct ksock_peer;                              /* forward ref */
00269 struct ksock_route;                             /* forward ref */
00270 struct ksock_proto;                             /* forward ref */
00271 
00272 typedef struct                                  /* transmit packet */
00273 {
00274         struct list_head   tx_list;     /* queue on conn for transmission etc */
00275         struct list_head   tx_zc_list;  /* queue on peer for ZC request */
00276         atomic_t       tx_refcount;    /* tx reference count */
00277         int            tx_nob;         /* # packet bytes */
00278         int            tx_resid;       /* residual bytes */
00279         int            tx_niov;        /* # packet kvec frags */
00280         struct kvec  *tx_iov;         /* packet kvec frags */
00281         int            tx_nkiov;       /* # packet page frags */
00282         unsigned short tx_zc_aborted;  /* aborted ZC request */
00283         unsigned short tx_zc_capable:1; /* payload is large enough for ZC */
00284         unsigned short tx_zc_checked:1; /* Have I checked if I should ZC? */
00285         unsigned short tx_nonblk:1;    /* it's a non-blocking ACK */
00286         lnet_kiov_t   *tx_kiov;        /* packet page frags */
00287         struct ksock_conn *tx_conn;        /* owning conn */
00288         lnet_msg_t    *tx_lnetmsg;     /* lnet message for lnet_finalize() */
00289         cfs_time_t     tx_deadline;    /* when (in jiffies) tx times out */
00290         ksock_msg_t    tx_msg;         /* socklnd message buffer */
00291         int            tx_desc_size;   /* size of this descriptor */
00292         union {
00293                 struct {
00294                         struct kvec iov;        /* virt hdr */
00295                         lnet_kiov_t kiov[0];    /* paged payload */
00296                 }                  paged;
00297                 struct {
00298                         struct kvec iov[1];     /* virt hdr + payload */
00299                 }                  virt;
00300         }                       tx_frags;
00301 } ksock_tx_t;
00302 
00303 #define KSOCK_NOOP_TX_SIZE  ((int)offsetof(ksock_tx_t, tx_frags.paged.kiov[0]))
00304 
00305 /* network zero copy callback descriptor embedded in ksock_tx_t */
00306 
00307 /* space for the rx frag descriptors; we either read a single contiguous
00308  * header, or up to LNET_MAX_IOV frags of payload of either type. */
00309 typedef union {
00310         struct kvec     iov[LNET_MAX_IOV];
00311         lnet_kiov_t      kiov[LNET_MAX_IOV];
00312 } ksock_rxiovspace_t;
00313 
00314 #define SOCKNAL_RX_KSM_HEADER   1               /* reading ksock message header */
00315 #define SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_HEADER  2               /* reading lnet message header */
00316 #define SOCKNAL_RX_PARSE        3               /* Calling lnet_parse() */
00317 #define SOCKNAL_RX_PARSE_WAIT   4               /* waiting to be told to read the body */
00318 #define SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_PAYLOAD 5               /* reading lnet payload (to deliver here) */
00319 #define SOCKNAL_RX_SLOP         6               /* skipping body */
00320 
00321 typedef struct ksock_conn
00322 {
00323         struct ksock_peer  *ksnc_peer;          /* owning peer */
00324         struct ksock_route *ksnc_route;         /* owning route */
00325         struct list_head    ksnc_list;          /* stash on peer's conn list */
00326         struct socket       *ksnc_sock;         /* actual socket */
00327         void                *ksnc_saved_data_ready; /* socket's original data_ready() callback */
00328         void                *ksnc_saved_write_space; /* socket's original write_space() callback */
00329         atomic_t            ksnc_conn_refcount; /* conn refcount */
00330         atomic_t            ksnc_sock_refcount; /* sock refcount */
00331         ksock_sched_t       *ksnc_scheduler;  /* who schedules this connection */
00332         __u32               ksnc_myipaddr;   /* my IP */
00333         __u32               ksnc_ipaddr;     /* peer's IP */
00334         int                 ksnc_port;       /* peer's port */
00335         signed int          ksnc_type:3;     /* type of connection,
00336                                               * should be signed value */
00337         unsigned int        ksnc_closing:1;  /* being shut down */
00338         unsigned int        ksnc_flip:1;     /* flip or not, only for V2.x */
00339         unsigned int        ksnc_zc_capable:1; /* enable to ZC */
00340         struct ksock_proto *ksnc_proto;      /* protocol for the connection */
00341 
00342         /* READER */
00343 
00344         /* where I enq waiting input or a forwarding descriptor */
00345         struct list_head   ksnc_rx_list;
00346         cfs_time_t            ksnc_rx_deadline; /* when (in jiffies) receive times out */
00347         __u8                  ksnc_rx_started;  /* started receiving a message */
00348         __u8                  ksnc_rx_ready;    /* data ready to read */
00349         __u8                  ksnc_rx_scheduled;/* being progressed */
00350         __u8                  ksnc_rx_state;    /* what is being read */
00351         int                   ksnc_rx_nob_left; /* # bytes to next hdr/body */
00352         int                   ksnc_rx_nob_wanted; /* bytes actually wanted */
00353         int                   ksnc_rx_niov;     /* # kvec frags */
00354         struct kvec          *ksnc_rx_iov;      /* the kvec frags */
00355         int                   ksnc_rx_nkiov;    /* # page frags */
00356         lnet_kiov_t          *ksnc_rx_kiov;     /* the page frags */
00357         ksock_rxiovspace_t    ksnc_rx_iov_space;/* space for frag descriptors */
00358         __u32                 ksnc_rx_csum;     /* partial checksum for incoming data */
00359         void                 *ksnc_cookie;      /* rx lnet_finalize passthru arg */
00360         ksock_msg_t           ksnc_msg;         /* incoming message buffer:
00361                                                  * V2.x message takes the
00362                                                  * whole struct
00363                                                  * V1.x message is a bare
00364                                                  * lnet_hdr_t, it's stored in
00365                                                  * ksnc_msg.ksm_u.lnetmsg */
00366 
00367         /* -- WRITER -- */
00368         /* where I enq waiting for output space */
00369         struct list_head        ksnc_tx_list;
00370         /* packets waiting to be sent */
00371         struct list_head        ksnc_tx_queue;
00372         /* next TX that can carry a LNet message or ZC-ACK */
00373         ksock_tx_t              *ksnc_tx_carrier;
00374         /* when (in jiffies) tx times out */
00375         cfs_time_t              ksnc_tx_deadline;
00376         /* send buffer marker */
00377         int                     ksnc_tx_bufnob;
00378         /* # bytes queued */
00379         atomic_t                ksnc_tx_nob;
00380         /* write space */
00381         int                     ksnc_tx_ready;
00382         /* being progressed */
00383         int                     ksnc_tx_scheduled;
00384         /* time stamp of the last posted TX */
00385         cfs_time_t              ksnc_tx_last_post;
00386 } ksock_conn_t;
00387 
00388 typedef struct ksock_route
00389 {
00390         struct list_head   ksnr_list;           /* chain on peer route list */
00391         struct list_head   ksnr_connd_list;     /* chain on ksnr_connd_routes */
00392         struct ksock_peer *ksnr_peer;           /* owning peer */
00393         atomic_t           ksnr_refcount;       /* # users */
00394         cfs_time_t            ksnr_timeout;     /* when (in jiffies) reconnection can happen next */
00395         cfs_duration_t        ksnr_retry_interval; /* how long between retries */
00396         __u32                 ksnr_myipaddr;    /* my IP */
00397         __u32                 ksnr_ipaddr;      /* IP address to connect to */
00398         int                   ksnr_port;        /* port to connect to */
00399         unsigned int          ksnr_scheduled:1; /* scheduled for attention */
00400         unsigned int          ksnr_connecting:1;/* connection establishment in progress */
00401         unsigned int          ksnr_connected:4; /* connections established by type */
00402         unsigned int          ksnr_deleted:1;   /* been removed from peer? */
00403         unsigned int          ksnr_share_count; /* created explicitly? */
00404         int                   ksnr_conn_count;  /* # conns established by this route */
00405 } ksock_route_t;
00406 
00407 #define SOCKNAL_KEEPALIVE_PING          1       /* cookie for keepalive ping */
00408 
00409 typedef struct ksock_peer
00410 {
00411         struct list_head        ksnp_list;      /* stash on global peer list */
00412         cfs_time_t            ksnp_last_alive;  /* when (in jiffies) I was last alive */
00413         lnet_process_id_t     ksnp_id;       /* who's on the other end(s) */
00414         atomic_t              ksnp_refcount; /* # users */
00415         int                   ksnp_sharecount;  /* lconf usage counter */
00416         int                   ksnp_closing;  /* being closed */
00417         int                   ksnp_accepting;/* # passive connections pending */
00418         int                   ksnp_error;    /* errno on closing last conn */
00419         __u64                 ksnp_zc_next_cookie;/* ZC completion cookie */
00420         __u64                 ksnp_incarnation;   /* latest known peer incarnation */
00421         struct ksock_proto   *ksnp_proto;    /* latest known peer protocol */
00422         struct list_head        ksnp_conns;     /* all active connections */
00423         struct list_head        ksnp_routes;    /* routes */
00424         struct list_head        ksnp_tx_queue;  /* waiting packets */
00425         spinlock_t            ksnp_lock;        /* serialize, g_lock unsafe */
00426         /* zero copy requests wait for ACK  */
00427         struct list_head        ksnp_zc_req_list;
00428         cfs_time_t            ksnp_send_keepalive; /* time to send keepalive */
00429         lnet_ni_t            *ksnp_ni;       /* which network */
00430         int                   ksnp_n_passive_ips; /* # of... */
00431         __u32                 ksnp_passive_ips[LNET_MAX_INTERFACES]; /* preferred local interfaces */
00432 } ksock_peer_t;
00433 
00434 typedef struct ksock_connreq
00435 {
00436         /* stash on ksnd_connd_connreqs */
00437         struct list_head        ksncr_list;
00438         /* chosen NI */
00439         lnet_ni_t               *ksncr_ni;
00440         /* accepted socket */
00441         struct socket           *ksncr_sock;
00442 } ksock_connreq_t;
00443 
00444 extern ksock_nal_data_t ksocknal_data;
00445 extern ksock_tunables_t ksocknal_tunables;
00446 
00447 #define SOCKNAL_MATCH_NO        0        /* TX can't match type of connection */
00448 #define SOCKNAL_MATCH_YES       1        /* TX matches type of connection */
00449 #define SOCKNAL_MATCH_MAY       2        /* TX can be sent on the connection, but not preferred */
00450 
00451 typedef struct ksock_proto
00452 {
00453         int           pro_version;                                              /* version number of protocol */
00454         int         (*pro_send_hello)(ksock_conn_t *, ksock_hello_msg_t *);     /* handshake function */
00455         int         (*pro_recv_hello)(ksock_conn_t *, ksock_hello_msg_t *, int);/* handshake function */
00456         void        (*pro_pack)(ksock_tx_t *);                                  /* message pack */
00457         void        (*pro_unpack)(ksock_msg_t *);                               /* message unpack */
00458         ksock_tx_t *(*pro_queue_tx_msg)(ksock_conn_t *, ksock_tx_t *);          /* queue tx on the connection */
00459         int         (*pro_queue_tx_zcack)(ksock_conn_t *, ksock_tx_t *, __u64); /* queue ZC ack on the connection */
00460         int         (*pro_handle_zcreq)(ksock_conn_t *, __u64, int);            /* handle ZC request */
00461         int         (*pro_handle_zcack)(ksock_conn_t *, __u64, __u64);          /* handle ZC ACK */
00462         int         (*pro_match_tx)(ksock_conn_t *, ksock_tx_t *, int);         /* msg type matches the connection type:
00463                                                                                  * return value:
00464                                                                                  *   return MATCH_NO  : no
00465                                                                                  *   return MATCH_YES : matching type
00466                                                                                  *   return MATCH_MAY : can be backup */
00467 } ksock_proto_t;
00468 
00469 extern ksock_proto_t ksocknal_protocol_v1x;
00470 extern ksock_proto_t ksocknal_protocol_v2x;
00471 extern ksock_proto_t ksocknal_protocol_v3x;
00472 
00473 #define KSOCK_PROTO_V1_MAJOR    LNET_PROTO_TCP_VERSION_MAJOR
00474 #define KSOCK_PROTO_V1_MINOR    LNET_PROTO_TCP_VERSION_MINOR
00475 #define KSOCK_PROTO_V1          KSOCK_PROTO_V1_MAJOR
00476 
00477 #ifndef CPU_MASK_NONE
00478 #define CPU_MASK_NONE   0UL
00479 #endif
00480 
00481 static inline __u32 ksocknal_csum(__u32 crc, unsigned char const *p, size_t len)
00482 {
00483 #if 1
00484         return crc32_le(crc, p, len);
00485 #else
00486         while (len-- > 0)
00487                 crc = ((crc + 0x100) & ~0xff) | ((crc + *p++) & 0xff) ;
00488 
00489         return crc;
00490 #endif
00491 }
00492 
00493 static inline int
00494 ksocknal_route_mask(void)
00495 {
00496         if (!*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_typed_conns)
00497                 return (1 << SOCKLND_CONN_ANY);
00498 
00499         return ((1 << SOCKLND_CONN_CONTROL) |
00500                 (1 << SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_IN) |
00501                 (1 << SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_OUT));
00502 }
00503 
00504 static inline struct list_head *
00505 ksocknal_nid2peerlist (lnet_nid_t nid)
00506 {
00507         unsigned int hash = ((unsigned int)nid) % ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size;
00508 
00509         return (&ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers [hash]);
00510 }
00511 
00512 static inline void
00513 ksocknal_conn_addref (ksock_conn_t *conn)
00514 {
00515         LASSERT (atomic_read(&conn->ksnc_conn_refcount) > 0);
00516         atomic_inc(&conn->ksnc_conn_refcount);
00517 }
00518 
00519 extern void ksocknal_queue_zombie_conn (ksock_conn_t *conn);
00520 extern void ksocknal_finalize_zcreq(ksock_conn_t *conn);
00521 
00522 static inline void
00523 ksocknal_conn_decref (ksock_conn_t *conn)
00524 {
00525         LASSERT (atomic_read(&conn->ksnc_conn_refcount) > 0);
00526         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&conn->ksnc_conn_refcount))
00527                 ksocknal_queue_zombie_conn(conn);
00528 }
00529 
00530 static inline int
00531 ksocknal_connsock_addref (ksock_conn_t *conn)
00532 {
00533         int   rc = -ESHUTDOWN;
00534 
00535         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00536         if (!conn->ksnc_closing) {
00537                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&conn->ksnc_sock_refcount) > 0);
00538                 atomic_inc(&conn->ksnc_sock_refcount);
00539                 rc = 0;
00540         }
00541         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00542 
00543         return (rc);
00544 }
00545 
00546 static inline void
00547 ksocknal_connsock_decref (ksock_conn_t *conn)
00548 {
00549         LASSERT (atomic_read(&conn->ksnc_sock_refcount) > 0);
00550         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&conn->ksnc_sock_refcount)) {
00551                 LASSERT (conn->ksnc_closing);
00552                 sock_release(conn->ksnc_sock);
00553                 conn->ksnc_sock = NULL;
00554                 ksocknal_finalize_zcreq(conn);
00555         }
00556 }
00557 
00558 static inline void
00559 ksocknal_tx_addref (ksock_tx_t *tx)
00560 {
00561         LASSERT (atomic_read(&tx->tx_refcount) > 0);
00562         atomic_inc(&tx->tx_refcount);
00563 }
00564 
00565 extern void ksocknal_tx_prep (ksock_conn_t *, ksock_tx_t *tx);
00566 extern void ksocknal_tx_done (lnet_ni_t *ni, ksock_tx_t *tx);
00567 
00568 static inline void
00569 ksocknal_tx_decref (ksock_tx_t *tx)
00570 {
00571         LASSERT (atomic_read(&tx->tx_refcount) > 0);
00572         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&tx->tx_refcount))
00573                 ksocknal_tx_done(NULL, tx);
00574 }

00580         atomic_inc(&route->ksnr_refcount);
00581 }

00589         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&route->ksnr_refcount))
00590                 ksocknal_destroy_route (route);
00591 }

00594 ksocknal_peer_addref (ksock_peer_t *peer)

00596         LASSERT (atomic_read (&peer->ksnp_refcount) > 0);
00597         atomic_inc(&peer->ksnp_refcount);
00598 }

00600 extern void ksocknal_destroy_peer (ksock_peer_t *peer);
00601 
00602 static inline void
00603 ksocknal_peer_decref (ksock_peer_t *peer)
00604 {
00605         LASSERT (atomic_read (&peer->ksnp_refcount) > 0);
00606         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&peer->ksnp_refcount))
00607                 ksocknal_destroy_peer (peer);
00608 }
